title: The Legislative Branch
subtle:
Informational (nonfiction), 1,978 words, Level Z1 (Grade 5+), Lexile 1040L            
                        
		Multilevel Book also available in levels                     O and W
description: The Constitution gave the legislative branch the power to make and change laws, among other important duties. The legislative branch, also called Congress, is made up of the Senate and the House of Representatives. By voting to elect senators and representatives, U.S. citizens exercise their role in government.
highFrequencyWords: Use of vocabulary lessons requires a subscription to VocabularyA-Z.com.
